Interface com.penthera.virtuososdk.client.IAsset
Inherited members: ShowHide
Deprecated: ShowHide
com.penthera.virtuososdk.client

Interface IAsset

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IIdentifier
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IFile, ISegmentedAsset
    public interface IAsset extends IIdentifier
    Base interface for all the assets you can download.
    An asset may be a single file, or consist of multiple files.
    This interface provides access to all the attributes common to the specialized interfaces.

      getEad 
      abstract long getEad()
      (Expiry After Download or 'EAD') Duration this asset will remain available to the user after it has completed downloading.
      long getEad()
      (Expiry After Download or 'EAD') Duration this asset will remain available to the user after it has completed downloading. As soon as possible after EAD has elapsed, Virtuoso will delete the asset.
      Returns:
      Amount of time (in seconds) the asset is to be available after download completes.
      getEap 
      abstract long getEap()
      (Expiry After Play or 'EAP') Amount of time this asset will remain available to the user after it has been first played.
      long getEap()
      (Expiry After Play or 'EAP') Amount of time this asset will remain available to the user after it has been first played. As soon as possible after EAP has elapsed, Virtuoso will delete this asset. Note: For EAP windowing to work, Virtuoso must know when the asset is first played. It's your responsibility to register a play-start Event with Virtuoso.
      Returns:
      Amount of time (in seconds) the asset is to be available after first playout.
      See Also:
      Common.Events.addPlayStartEvent(Context, java.lang.String, java.lang.String)
      getEndWindow 
      abstract long getEndWindow()
      Current end window applied to this asset
      long getEndWindow()
      Current end window applied to this asset
      Returns:
      A timestamp, represented as the number of seconds since the unix epoch. Returns Long.MAX_VALUE if an end window has not been set.
      getErrorCount 
      abstract long getErrorCount()
      Number of errors encountered during download of this asset.
      long getErrorCount()
      Number of errors encountered during download of this asset. Once this value reaches 3, Virtuoso will stop attempting to download the asset.
      Returns:
      The error count

      getFirstPlayTime 
      abstract long getFirstPlayTime()
      When this asset was first played.
      long getFirstPlayTime()
      When this asset was first played. Note: It is your responsibility to register a play-start event with Virtuoso; otherwise the returned value will be 0.
      Returns:
      When the asset was first played
      See Also:
      Common.Events.addPlayStartEvent(Context, java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

      getId 
      abstract int getId()
      An integer id for the asset
      This id is only valid once the asset has actually been added to the Service.

      Returns:

      getLastPermissionResponse 
      abstract IAssetPermission getLastPermissionResponse()
      Permission response from Backplane.
      IAssetPermission getLastPermissionResponse()
      Permission response from Backplane.
      The permissions are requested from the backplane if the Max Account Downloads or Max Asset Downloads settings have been configured. The permission is evaluated when added to the queue. If configured and the permission check is not required at time of queuing then the permission code in the the IAssetPermission permission code will be set to PERMISSION_AWAITING_PERMISSI0N until the permission is checked at time of download.
      Returns:
      The IAssetPermission or null if not yet added to queue.
      getLastStatusCode 
      abstract int getLastStatusCode()
      Last known HTTP status code from the download of this asset
      int getLastStatusCode()
      Last known HTTP status code from the download of this asset
      Returns:
      The last response code or 0.

      abstract void setAssetUrl(java.lang.String aAssetUrl)
      Set the URL where the asset is to be downloaded from.

      setCustomHeaders 
      abstract void setCustomHeaders(Bundle headers)
      Set custom HTTP headers for this asset.
      void setCustomHeaders(Bundle headers)
      Set custom HTTP headers for this asset.
      Virtuoso includes these headers as part of the HTTP GET request when downloading this asset. Virtuoso includes these headers after the default headers, and thus these take precedence.
      Parameters:
      headers - A bundle specifying the headers to be applied for this asset (key/value pairs).

      abstract void setEad(long ead)
      (Expiry After Download or 'EAD') Set the duration this asset will remain available after it has completed downloading.

      (Expiry After Download or 'EAD') Set the duration this asset will remain available after it has completed downloading.
      Parameters:
      ead - Amount of time (in seconds) the asset is to remain available after download completes.
      setEap 
      abstract void setEap(long eap)
      (Expiry After Play or 'EAP') Set the duration this asset will remain available after it has been first played.
      void setEap(long eap)
      (Expiry After Play or 'EAP') Set the duration this asset will remain available after it has been first played.
      Parameters:
      eap - Amount of time (in seconds) the asset is to remain available after first playout.
      setEndWindow 
      abstract void setEndWindow(long end)
      Set the end window for playback.
      void setEndWindow(long end)
      Set the end window for playback.
      After this time, the asset will no longer be available for playback through Virtuoso. Any attempt to retrieve the location of this asset on disk, through a Virtuoso API, will return null.
      After this time, Virtuoso will delete this asset from disk as soon as possible.
      Parameters:
      end - A timestamp, represented as the number of seconds since the unix epoch.
      setMetadata 
      abstract void setMetadata(java.lang.String aMetaData)
      A convenience method allowing you to persist metadata with an asset.
      void setMetadata(java.lang.String aMetaData)
      A convenience method allowing you to persist metadata with an asset.
      Parameters:
      aMetaData - The metadata to be persisted along with the asset. Typically a JSON String.
      setStartWindow 
      abstract void setStartWindow(long start)
      Set the start window for playback.
      void setStartWindow(long start)
      Set the start window for playback.
      Attempts to access or play this asset through a Virtuoso API will return null until this time has passed.
      A newly-created asset defaults to having a start window of 'now'.
      Parameters:
      start - A timestamp, represented as the number of seconds since the unix epoch.
